body_html:
Just to chime in, it seems that some image ops (e.g. tf.image.random_brightness(), tf.image.random_contrast()) allow batches, while others (e.g. tf.image.random_saturation(), tf.image.random_hue()) do not – it would make sense to either make all the image ops accept batches, or at least note on the documentation that they don't.

(also, does the "awaiting tensorflower" tag mean a TF dev is working on this, or is this open to contributions?)
body_text:
Just to chime in, it seems that some image ops (e.g. tf.image.random_brightness(), tf.image.random_contrast()) allow batches, while others (e.g. tf.image.random_saturation(), tf.image.random_hue()) do not – it would make sense to either make all the image ops accept batches, or at least note on the documentation that they don't.
(also, does the "awaiting tensorflower" tag mean a TF dev is working on this, or is this open to contributions?)
body:
Just to chime in, it seems that some image ops (e.g. `tf.image.random_brightness()`, `tf.image.random_contrast()`) allow batches, while others (e.g. `tf.image.random_saturation()`, `tf.image.random_hue()`) do not – it would make sense to either make all the image ops accept batches, or at least note on the documentation that they don't.

(also, does the "awaiting tensorflower" tag mean a TF dev is working on this, or is this open to contributions?)
